snippet: More perhaps than any presidential contest in years, the choice between Mr. Obama and Mr. Romney presents voters with starkly different ideas about government’s place in American society.
abstract: Campaign Memo; choice between Pres Obama and Mitt Romney presents voters with starkly different philosophies about the role of government in American society, perhaps more so than in any recent presidential election.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from Bowling Green, Ohio.

lead_paragraph: More perhaps than any presidential contest in years, the choice between Mr. Obama and Mr. Romney presents voters with starkly different ideas about government’s place in American society.

headline.main: Philosophic Clash Over Government’s Role Highlights Parties’ Divide
headline.print_headline: Philosophic Clash Over Government’s Role Highlights Parties’ Divide
